definition: lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
group/crowd/flock, herd, pack etc
variant of 群[qun2]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: This man is the black sheep of the family.
sentences.chinese: 这个人是家庭中的害群之马。

sentences.english: Ann: There are still some black sheep in our society.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的社会上还是有这么一些害群之马的。

sentences.english: They say I am the black sheep of the relay race .
sentences.chinese: 他们说我是接力赛的害群之马。

sentences.english: But we should be aware not to let the black sheep take the lead.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我们不应能让那些害群之马来领头。

sentences.english: I was the black sheep of the family at that time.
sentences.chinese: 那时候我是家里的害群之马。

sentences.english: When it comes to friends, there's bound to be a few bad apples in the bunch.
sentences.chinese: 提到朋友，在那么一大堆人里必定有几个害群之马。

definition: scum of a community/degenerate
insect that eats into wood, books, clothes etc/fig. vermin
noxious winds, evil influences (idiom); malignant social trends
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to punish severely (idiom)
variant of 殺一儆百|杀一儆百[sha1 yi1 jing3 bai3]
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
to deal a single fatal blow/(fig.) to totally repudiate sb because of a minor error
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
to start rumours and create trouble
